availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p: Ordered that James, A, Wilhite and William R Blankenship be recommended to his excellency the Governor of this Commonwealth of Kentucky as suitable persons to fill the office of Justice of the peace.' in district No 7.) as there was no Election held in said Destrict in May last to Elect Justices & Constables on account of hostilities

A true Copy attest
E. P. Davis clk C C C

Ordered that Littleton.T. Whitten and Samuel McDavid be recommended to his Excellency the Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky to fill the office of Justice of the peace in destrict No 6) as there was no Election held in said destrict in May last to Elect Justice & constables on account of hostililties

A true Copy Attest
E. P. Davis clk
c c c c

Carter Co
Your Comms
JFR:
Justices
Appd July 20. 1863
